children.text: Some customer returns or refunds initiated through the Marketplace Returns Shipping Service (RSS) can be disputed.  Refer to

for a comprehensive list of reasons why customer returns may be disputed. All disputes must be filed within 45 days from the date the return or refund was issued. Disputes filed outside the 45-day period will be denied, and that denial will be final.

After receiving a high-value return, you’ll have 48 hours to evaluate it. If you determine an unsuccessful or erroneous return has taken place, you may file a dispute with the appropriate dispute reason.

Pro Tip: High-value items must be over $100 each. This includes all luxury items, such as Fine Art, Loose Gems & Gemstones, Jewelry & Watches above $300 and Collectibles, e.g., Coins, Stamps, Memorabilia and Precious Metals.
Return is different from the original item

as your dispute reason for an electronic product, you need to provide the serial numbers of the original item you sent and the item you received. We recommend taking photos of all serial numbers on items to keep for your records. This allows you to easily provide a photo as an attachment in case the need for a dispute arises.  For more generalized guidelines and dispute eligibility, see
Choosing the wrong dispute type can delay the review process and negatively impact the resolution.
Step 1 – Access the Returns & Refunds Dashboard
. Search for a return by the Purchase Order number or the Return Merchandise Authorization (RMA) number. Select the
beside the return you’re looking for to see more details.
Initiate a dispute by selecting the

button, which will open the dispute wizard. If an order has more than one of the same items, you can submit a dispute for one of the items or the entire order. Select the quantity, then select a dispute reason from the dropdown that best describes your issue. Certain dispute reasons will prompt you to select a subcategory.
If you don’t see the dispute button, it’s because the refund has not been issued, the dispute window has passed for that return, or the return has already been disputed.

Upload supporting photos or documentation when you create your dispute. Documentation, including an image of the return label with tracking and images of the product showing the problem with the return is required for the following dispute reasons:
I sent the customer a replacement
button. You’ll receive an email confirmation with the case number.
Q: How long will it take for my dispute to be reviewed and resolved?
A: Typically, it can take up to 72 hours. However, in some instances the timeframe could be extended.
Q: What happens to the customer refund during this process?

A: The customer refund will be put on hold for 72 hours while Walmart reviews your dispute. Customer refund holds will be automatically released after 72 hours. If the dispute is approved within that time frame, the customer will not be refunded and their return will be canceled.
Q: What happens if my dispute is denied? Can I appeal the decision?

A: Yes. If you're not satisfied with the resolution of your dispute provided by Walmart, you can submit an appeal. You can only appeal a decision once, and it must be submitted within 30 days of receiving the denial or decision.
with Seller Support through the following path:
Q: Can I track the status of my dispute?
A: Yes, you can track the status of a dispute through the

meta_data.salesforce_summary: Learn how to file a dispute for a customer return.

items.name: Returns and Disputes
items.description: Returns happen, but – depending on the situation – you may need to file a dispute for a customer return. Keep watching to learn how to file a returns-related dispute for your items–including items of high-value. We'll also go over how to track the approval status in Seller Center.

children.text: While returns are a natural part of the post-purchase experience, you may encounter instances when the returned item is damaged, or missing parts or accessories. Keep reading to determine if you’re eligible to dispute a customer return with Walmart, and find out how to file the dispute via the
For more generalized guidelines that Marketplace sellers must follow when filing a dispute, see
Dispute eligibility and policies vary for high-value and electronic items. More information on this below.
